sentences.en: After the design, modernism concept appears most early in the construction domain.
sentences.cn: 设计中的后现代主义概念最早出现在建筑领域.

sentences.en: Architecture form emerged in Art Nouveau is called " Modernism " in Spain.
sentences.cn: 新艺术运动中出现的建筑形式,在西班牙被称为 “ 现代式”,而巴塞罗那则汇聚了 “ 现代式”建筑的主要作品.

sentences.en: Held straddles Modernism and Post - Modernism.
sentences.cn: 赫尔德兼备现代主义和后现代主义.

sentences.en: His early poetry was influenced by the modernism and surrealism.
sentences.cn: 他的早期诗作受现代主义和梦幻主义影响.

sentences.en: How does allegory function in Courbet's Modernism?
sentences.cn: 寓言如何在库尔贝的现代主义中起作用?

sentences.en: In Chinese free - style verse , modernism is adroit at creating images.
sentences.cn: 在中国新诗史上, “现代派”是营造意象的高手.

sentences.en: Instead post - modernism took the popular and pared down as its aesthetic guide.
sentences.cn: 相反地,他们采取大众的眼光,成为他们的美学指导.

sentences.en: Modernism and latter modernism design first from construction start.
sentences.cn: 现代主义和后现代主义设计首先从建筑开始.

sentences.en: Modernism became popular in the early part of the 20 th century.
sentences.cn: 现代主义在20世纪初开始流行起来.

sentences.en: Modernism takes the irrational philosophy and the theory of psycho - analysis as its theoretical base.
sentences.cn: 现代主义以非理性哲学和精神分析原理作为理论基础.

sentences.en: Modernism was the characteristic expression of the experience of modernity.
sentences.cn: 现代主义是现代经验的典型表现.

sentences.en: Post - modernism has appeared as revolt.
sentences.cn: 后 现代主义 已经以反叛者的面目出现.

sentences.en: Ruiz - Geli is not interested in returning to the dark ages before Modernism.
sentences.cn: 鲁伊斯 -杰利对回到前现代主义的黑暗时代并不感兴趣.

sentences.en: That project is called'The Emergence of European Modernism 1870 - 1914 '.
sentences.cn: 该项目的名称是“欧洲现代主义的出现 1870--1914 ”.

sentences.en: The post - modernism revolt against The Promise has its paradox too.
sentences.cn: 对《无极》的后现代反叛同样存在悖论.

sentences.en: the rise of modernism in Paris
sentences.cn: 现代主义在巴黎的兴起

words.tran_cn: 现代的，现代化的；现代派的，现代主义的
现代主义者；现代主义艺术家
现代性；现代的东西；新式
现代主义；现代思想；现代作风

trans.tran_cn: [宗]现代主义，现代想法，现代用法，现代风尚，现代标准
trans.tran_en: a style of art, building etc that was popular especially from the 1940s to the 1960s, in which artists used simple shapes and modern artificial materials
